text:
Gusinje (Montenegrin Cyrillic: Гусиње,), is a small town and municipality in north-eastern Montenegro. In 2011, it has a population of 4,027 people.
Name.
The name "Gusinje" (Гусиње) is derived from "guska" (goose). Its older name was "Gousino" (Гоусино). In the Ottoman period, it was known as Turkish "Gusna" (گوسن). In Albanian, it is known as "Gucia".
Geography.
The town is in the Plav-Gusinje ravine of the Prokletije, at an elevation of ca. 1,000 m.
